DataElement.preferredName: Lymph Node Between Aorta Bifurcation And Inferior Mesenteric Artery Dissection Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator that asks whether lymph nodes between the aortic bifurcation and the inferior mesenteric artery were removed according to a surgical dissection technique.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymph Node Between Aorta Bifurcation And Inferior Mesenteric Artery Dissection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._The space or interval separating two things._The major arterial trunk that carries oxygenated blood from the left ventricle into the ascending aorta behind the heart, the aortic arch, through the thorax as the descending aorta and through the abdomen as the abdominal aorta; it bifurcates into the left and right common iliac arteries._A division of a main body into two parts._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A blood vessel arising from the aorta that supplies blood to the descending and sigmoid colon as well as the rectum._The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredName: Between Aorta Bifurcation And Inferior Mesenteric Artery Dissection
Property.preferredDefinition: The space or interval separating two things.:The major arterial trunk that carries oxygenated blood from the left ventricle into the ascending aorta behind the heart, the aortic arch, through the thorax as the descending aorta and through the abdomen as the abdominal aorta; it bifurcates into the left and right common iliac arteries.:A division of a main body into two parts.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A blood vessel arising from the aorta that supplies blood to the descending and sigmoid colon as well as the rectum.:The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

Concepts.definition: The space or interval separating two things.

The major arterial trunk that carries oxygenated blood from the left ventricle into the ascending aorta behind the heart, the aortic arch, through the thorax as the descending aorta and through the abdomen as the abdominal aorta; it bifurcates into the left and right common iliac arteries.
A division of a main body into two parts.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A blood vessel arising from the aorta that supplies blood to the descending and sigmoid colon as well as the rectum.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
